intro: Sobralia caloglossa, commonly known as the golden sobralia, is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in the understory of rainforests. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and often have a waxy texture, adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Sobralia caloglossa is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
